content:
There are several other options available that might be helpful to first-time buyers struggling to afford a home in Walsall. Here are some additional options:

1. Help from family: Some first-time buyers are able to receive financial help from family members to make a deposit or afford a mortgage.

2. Renting: While it's not the same as owning a home, renting can be a more affordable short-term option for many people. It's worth exploring rental options in Walsall to see if any could be a good choice for you.

3. Consider other locations: House prices and rents can vary drastically between towns and cities, so it might be worth looking at more affordable areas nearby or further afield.

4. Government schemes: There are several other government schemes available beyond the ones mentioned earlier, such as the Lifetime ISA, which can help first-time buyers save up for a deposit.

5. Take on extra work: If possible, taking on extra work or overtime to increase your income could help you save up for a deposit or afford a mortgage.

Ultimately, the best option will depend on your individual situation, needs, and budget. It's worth exploring multiple options and speaking with a local mortgage advisor or financial expert to determine the best approach for you.
